title: Sierra Norte 2016 Porta Regia Colección Privada Old Vines Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Rough, rubbery aromas suggest road tar. This Monastrell feels clumsy and hollow. Raw, slightly weedy berry flavors are green and minty on a chewy finish.
designation: Porta Regia Colección Privada Old Vines

title: Dalton 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)
description: With aromas of petrol and spearmint, this wine has flavors of lemon-lime and eucalyptus that do not feel completely integrated. Citrus and minty flavors fight for dominance on the palate, with cooling herb flavors overpowering the finish.

title: Felix Solis 2016 Flirty Bird Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc has little to no varietal character. The nose is quiet, with just a hint of peach. A round palate shows almost no acidity, while this tastes peachy and yeasty prior to a pulpy finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Firefly Ridge 2015 The Red Flash Red (California)
description: This wine has respectable but generic fruit flavors, a soft texture and a touch of sugar to round off its edges. It is light to medium bodied and tastes low in acidity.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Small Lot Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is severe in acidity, with a somewhat jarring lack of fruit. Butterscotch and melted butter develop in the glass for a lingering richness.

title: Marqués de Montañana 2016 Selección Especial Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Pushy oak and heavy clove aromas seem excessive for this level of Garnacha. A rough, grating palate leads to oak-heavy flavors of clove and blackberry, while a persistent flavor of oak-driven clove controls the finish.

title: Paso a Paso 2016 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Prickly citrus aromas include notes of white flowers. Yeasty grapefruit and lime flavors are bland and short, while this ends flat, yeasty and lightly oxidized.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Château Tour Castillon 2015  Médoc
description: A serious commitment to wood aging has given this wine a dark-chocolate and extracted set of flavors. This masks the wine, which seems almost austere. It will likely remain tough.

title: Lo Sparviere NV Cuvée N. 7 Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of medicinal herb, crushed walnut and a whiff of adhesive bandage lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the bitter palate along with a candied note and vigorous bubbles.

title: Monterebro 2016 Joven Red (Jumilla)
description: Jammy, baked aromas are raisiny and slightly volatile. This blend of 85% Monastrell and Syrah is heavy and soupy, with dull edges. Herbal prune and raisin flavors are raw and green on the finish.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2016 Rosé (Douro)
description: This pale-colored wine, a blend of Tinta Francisca and Tinta Roriz, was aged in wood for eight months. That was probably too long, for the fruit has been sucked into the wood, leaving a trail of acidity behind.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Schmidt NV Pink Rosé (Applegate Valley)
description: Made entirely from Merlot, this sweet pink wine might pass for a simple white Zinfandel. The sugary sweetness comes with light flavors of cherry Kool-Aid.

title: Château les Mourlanes 2015  Médoc
description: Situated in the northern Médoc, this estate has added too much wood to the ripe fruit. It is hard to see how this high-toast and bitter coffee flavor will go. It's a shame because the fruit awaits there somewhere.

title: Bodegas Fariña 2016 Dama de Toro  (Toro)
description: This Tinta de Toro smells like a cherry Lifesaver. In the mouth, there's not much body or substance. Candied blackberry and cassis flavors are medicinal and jammy on the finish.

title: Astrales 2011 Godello (Valdeorras)
description: Stalky aromas of citrus peel are stale and mostly fruitless. A full, flat palate indicates a wine that has lost its youthful freshness, offering bitter apricot flavors and a finish that's low on acidity.

title: Muruve 2016 Joven  (Toro)
description: Rubbery, medicinal berry aromas smell like Pepto-Bismol. A chunky palate is big and blocky, with no elegance or charm. Candied, grapy flavors finish hard and scratchy.

title: Ochoa 2016 Calendas White (Navarra)
description: A light color and yeasty aromas of sourdough and dusty white fruits are the greeting on this modest white made from Chardonnay, Viura and Moscatel. Flavors of lime are yeasty and finish bitter.

title: Perelada NV Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Stalky aromas are more rough and fruitless than smooth and clean. This brut reserva foams up on the palate and feels clumsy. Briny flavors suggest white pepper but not much fruit, and it's grassy-tasting on the finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Hoya de Cadenas Single Estate Chardonnay (Utiel-Requena)
description: Tropical fruit aromas are soft and syrupy. This is chunky and low in acidity, with oily stone-fruit flavors. The finish feels a bit warm and cloying.

title: Chankaska 2015 Estate Marquette (Minnesota)
description: The nose of this Marquette is all spice and jammy dark berries, with whiffs of Luxardo cherries. The rounded palate shows warm, baked cranberry, blackberry, blueberry sauce and cedar. Soft tannins lend structure and quiet acidity teeters on the edge of flabby, finishing on cassis and a woody tang.

title: Giancarlo Ceci 2015 Almagia Rosso Biodinamico Red (Castel del Monte)
description: This Demeter certified blend of Uva di Troia and Montepulciano carries odd aromas of peanut skins, asparagus and saucy, sour red fruit. The palate offers a bit more enjoyment with its more fruit-forward nature, bracing acidity and abrasive tannins carrying to the finish.

title: Dodon 2015 Anne Arundel County Chardonnay (Maryland)
description: Aromas of praline, toffee and lime are aloof and tricky to coax from the glass, while the flat palate presents lemon pith and crème brûlée. The wine is largely neutral, with a lemon and latex finish.

title: Batán de Salas 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Strange, yeasty aromas suggest boiled ham and buttercup. This feels full and fleshy, with low acidity. It tastes like it smells: yeasty and much like ham, with little fruit.

title: Bodegas Berceo 2015 Más de Berceo Viura (Navarra)
description: Chunky oak rests heavily atop aromas of stale white fruits and nuts. This is obtuse in feel, with stalky, oaky flavors that are largely devoid of fresh fruit.

title: Folin Cellars 2015 Passive Aggressive Red (Rogue Valley)
description: This blend of Tempranillo, Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Syrah is thin and leathery. It's already dried out and not heading in a better direction. Two bottles sampled with the same results. Drink up.

title: Madrigal 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is slightly bittersweet and off-putting, with a dullness to the texture.

title: Santa Cruz de Alpera 2016 Verdejo (Almansa)
description: Melony aromas are neutral at best. A pulpy, citric palate holds briny orange flavors that don't show a lot of depth or quality. It falls apart on the finish.

title: Santo Cristo 2016 Flor de Añon Verdejo (Campo de Borja)
description: This offers light aromas of yeasty white flowers and lemon-lime. The palate is weak, while generic white-fruit flavors fall off quickly and taste oxidized on a bready finish.

title: Chopo 2016 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Blatant aromas of milk chocolate and candied-berry fruits amount to a soupy, heavy, jammy nose. This Monastrell feels choppy and broken. Saucy berry flavors are loaded with oak and clove notes, while this wine tastes like chocolate and feels hot on the finish.

title: Château la Gorce 2015  Médoc
description: Heavily toasty, this wine seems to rely on the wood aging rather than fruit. It does have weight and hints of juicy black currants in the background, but too much wood has not done the wine any favors.
